intro: Crepidomanes walleri, commonly known as the wall climbing thistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and spiny leaves that help it cling to walls and rocky surfaces. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. It is native to regions of Africa and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
